DOC.brief_summary: The photorefractive keratectomy was the first correction mode refractive laser. It's a photo-ablation of a predetermined thickness of anterior corneal stroma. Debridement of epithelium can be done either mechanically (m-PRK) or by laser (trans-PRK). Trans-PRK has a lot of interests: facility and speed of procedure as well as suppression of human variable. Very good results are obtained by m-PRK. The aim of this study is to show equivalence or non inferiority of trans-PRK over conventional m-PRK in terms of safety and refractive efficiency
DOC.brief_title: Efficiency, Predictability and Security of the Trans-epithelial Photorefractive Keratectomy
DOC.criteria: patients with stable refractive error (more than 2 years) Myopia up to 4.00 diopters and astigmatism up to 3.00 diopters Phototherapeutic keratectomy (PTK)
